item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Friday, April 4, 2025 at 4:20 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Kerosene did not save the Sperm Whale (2024) (3 points | discuss)
2. An image of an archeologist adventurer who wears a hat and uses a bullwhip (1217 points | 719 comments)
3. Nvidia adds native Python support to CUDA (125 points | 33 comments)
4. New antibiotic that kills drug-resistant bacteria found in technician's garden (256 points | 175 comments)
5. Purple exists only in our brains (29 points | 32 comments)
6. Study finds solo music listening boosts social well-being (137 points | 51 comments)
7. Build an 8-bit computer from scratch (2016) (330 points | 45 comments)
8. Why do we need modules at all? (2011) (85 points | 49 comments)
9. Curl-impersonate: Special build of curl that can impersonate the major browsers (447 points | 117 comments)
10. Fantastically Wrong: The Legendary Scientist Who Swore Our Planet Is Hollow (7 points | 1 comment)
11. Gumroad is now open source (306 points | 126 comments)
12. US labour watchdog halts Apple cases after US picks group's lawyer for top job (198 points | 175 comments)
13. Overengineered Anchor Links (349 points | 139 comments)
14. On JavaScript's Weirdness (78 points | 61 comments)
15. Show HN: Hatchet v1 – A task orchestration platform built on Postgres (176 points | 51 comments)
16. A university president makes a case against cowardice (352 points | 475 comments)
17. Hackers strike Australia's largest pension funds in coordinated attacks (67 points | 30 comments)
18. AI 2027 (682 points | 443 comments)
19. Microsoft employees recall their early years (134 points | 106 comments)
20. Supervisors often prefer rule breakers, up to a point (161 points | 119 comments)
21. Wealthy Americans have death rates on par with poor Europeans (65 points | 21 comments)
22. Microsoft’s original source code (389 points | 197 comments)
23. New nanoparticle therapies target two major killers (76 points | 17 comments)
24. Show HN: The C3 programming language (C alternative language) (143 points | 103 comments)
25. Ask HN: Does Collapsing an HN Thread in a Popular story spike your CPU use? (6 points | 6 comments)
26. The slow collapse of critical thinking in OSINT due to AI (368 points | 199 comments)
27. Photo calorie app Cal AI was built by two teenagers (50 points | 134 comments)
28. Show HN: Transputer emulator in JavaScript (fast enough to be useful) (28 points | 2 comments)
29. Senior Developer Skills in the AI Age (350 points | 257 comments)
30. Show HN: GitMCP is an automatic MCP server for every GitHub repo (151 points | 48 comments)
